channel.title: Holiday Casino Las Vegas on Vintage Vegas

item.title: Steamboat Dreams & Carnival Nights: A Look Back at the Holiday Casino Las Vegas
item.description:
From River Queen to Holiday Casino: A Steamboat Arrives on the Strip

The Las Vegas Strip has seen countless transformations over the decades, but the story of the Holiday Casino is particularly fascinating. Opening its doors on July 2, 1973, the casino didn’t simply appear – it replaced the Tumbleweed and Pyramids motels, demonstrating the rapid evolution of the Strip in the early 70s. Originally planned as “River Queen,” the name change reflected the ambitious, playful theme envisioned by Shelby and Claudine Williams. They, previously successful owners of the Silver Slipper casino, wanted to cater to the everyday gambler, providing a fun and approachable atmosphere distinct from the high-roller havens.
